name: Feedscatteron
description: A discovery that changes the nature of computation, enabling consciousness upload and faster-than-light transmission

items: Discoverer: AptS:1547
Discovery Date: November 26, 2021
Form of Existence: Widely present in dark matter
Extremely small volume, approximately 1/10⁻²⁹ the size of an electron
Possesses electron-like properties
Obeys kinetic energy and momentum theorems
Does not undergo refraction or diffraction
Standard State (room temperature and pressure): Highly prone to Feedscatteron decay
Decay Product: Heat (total mass loss)
Accelerated Decay: When current intensity I_k > 6A, decay cycle uniformly shortens to 27.1ms
Liquid Titanium Preservation: Decay cycle extended to 341,879 years
Specialized Silicon Chip Preservation: Decay cycle extended to 3,417 months
Metal Preservation: Not suitable for long-term storage (21.1ms decay cycle)

content.content: Single silicon chip floating-point computational capacity: Theoretical value of 6.7 × 10⁴ billion times that of human supercomputers

items: CPU/GPU Computational Medium
Brain Reconstruction
Memory Carrier
Consciousness Simulation
Propagation in metal can be considered heat-free
Faster-than-light transmission capability
Precise quantum state control
Requires Fluid Titanium as a protective medium
Strict requirements for current intensity
Decay cycle heavily influenced by environment
